title: Current State of League of Legends for Support Mains
body: As a support main I believe the current state of League of Legends is hard for those who only could play support. Despite my efforts of playing well in my past games in this current season, I keep on losing and have reached a certain point that my win rate is below 40% which is embarrassing to present to other players. In previous seasons, I was able to climb as a support main but due to immense changes to gameplay has caused supports to suffer. For me its hard to play other roles due to my nature as a helpful person and find it hard to play other roles. Throughout my 6-7 years of playing League Of Legends I have supported Riot Games by buying Riot Points to commend for their actions of creating a great but no longer feel like supporting commending them for making the game less enjoyable for those who play a role which gives lesser impact to the game.

replies.body:
Whats worse is we're dependent on NOT getting tards (protip; adcs are nothing but in my experience) so we have a harder time climbing. Support really need to get more rewards tbh. We're the ones that get nothing but blame while our adcs go off, int feed and troll the team. 
Like, less LP loss, more LP gain. lil more XP would go a long way too. 

In game rewards would be great too like a lil extra damage, or better scaling, or things like that. 
Supports are gettin shafted maaaaaaaaaaan :(

as much as it's harder to hardcarry in a single game, like any role; at the end of the day, 'can you outperform other players in the same role?'.

I might have abandoned being a support main this season in favour of the much more exciting jungle gameplay; but I'd say support is good role for climbing simply because not many people main it, even last season in the ardent meta (which was good for climbing as a support, but cancer because it made games very one dimensional and laning phase very boring). I was confident I could win *any* lane as janna, regardless of whether my adc was gold or bronze (and I infact did cheese my way to gold by duoing with a low elo adcs btw, always good for quick climbing if you can put up with the ego they develop after they win their first 5 games against gold players), and this was because compared to someone who decided to pick janna simply because she was op, I was an insane individual who thought janna was a toplaner in my first few months playing in season 6.
At least support is more impactful than top

> [{quoted}](name=MysticLlamaZ,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=3xIZAJPY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-02-21T10:01:24.311+0000)
>
> At least support is more impactful than top

RIIIIGHT THROUGH THE COUNTERSTRIKE

You know what supports should do? Less complaining. All of that complaining at the end of season 6 has contributed to the current state of the meta. Support items are overtuned and supports run the game at the moment. Back in the golden age of league (seasons 3&4), supports understood that they would have less gold, because gold is not essential to their role. They would actually support.
Then when champion select included hard fixed roles and autofill, people started crying, instead of actually learning the role and understanding it. Support is only a role because thats the way the meta is, you have an extra damage carry (marksman) in your team.
This season its truly too easy for supports to climb, and they should be whinging less, or changing their role to top if they really what to whinge.

You're obvs baiting, but in case you are legitimately not that.........well smart. 

Only if you were stupid and didn't know what to do in them seasons.  
Been supporting since then, and I usually (among others that knew how to play) ended with most gold. 

You also have adcs going "OMG SO OP MUST PLAY RANKED WITH IT" then go intentionally feed game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after game after as the champ giving the enemy team whats essentially freelo.

Instead of taking a shot of us players, actually play the game solo Q and you'll see i'm right.
He's not even Level 30 from what I've seen from his profile so he wouldn't have any experience from ranked queues. (No Offense because you may of had a account that have been banned)

When players in Diamond+ are building support items on other roles, you know that support items are overtuned. And yes I have played soloqueue before, its just that when you get to higher elo, you understand the game better as a whole.

it's less that these items are op (you don't see orianna with ardent censer anywhere outside of LCS as a cheese strat, as much as she gets alot of benefit out of it, nor any other roles aside from ivern building redemption), but more that they're being used to abuse a certain way of playing defensively earlygame, inspired by klepto and the 'gold rush' playstyle.

Support items aren't really overtuned... just too accessible. The worst abusers of ancient coin and spellthiefs aren't mage supports like karma, morgana or brand, no, that would be gangplank. That isn't supports being op, that's riot screwing up.

Imo a good mark of the state of support items is whether traditionally midlane mages are migrating botlane. When spellthiefs was op, we saw velkox, xerath and veigar.

Also support is just about as balanced as any other role. Jungle holds the most pressure, midlane shortly after, botlane holds dragon control and determines which team opens up the map first with first blood tower. Toplane is an island where nothing happens provided nobody fucks up. Toplane has a tank/gangplank problem, but that's more that riot has been beating down on traditional early/midgame bruisers like renekton, darius, irelia, kled, olaf and poppy (more damage oriented builds).

Support items were overtuned (when you see Vlad buying FQC, for example), so I'm glad that its been removed. Still, it would be better if their gold generation was tuned down to stop other laners using them. 8.4 pro play is gonna be the real test. I still expect Nidalee to get frostfang.
Just another example of them being overtuned - DaSticks builds the Eye of the watchers on Teemo as his first item in the current patch, and he's a challenger player and streamer.

the issue I have is, support items are op, on champions and roles that aren't support.
season 6, taking a support item (or even Cull, this item inexplicably would loses you lane) to a sololane or jungle was extremely inefficient, but with changes to the way support items balanced out gold income, kleptomancy and other sources of gold acceleration, support items became a problem.

Supports aren't abusing support items, income wise, they're still the poorest lane, and secondary support items are balanced enough that only supports really build things like redemption or rush locket or knights vow. However other lanes taking support items are getting even more gold.

Agree with the majority of your post, but:
"riot has been beating down on traditional early/midgame bruisers like renekton"
explain why renekton is still an absolute god then?

26th out of 49 toplaners. 49% winrate, 21st pickrate, 25th ban rate... outside of lore wise, he's not much of a god

even with his recent set of buffs, statistically he's worse than darius, aatrox, teemo and heimderginer. He is resilient, but he doesn't have a good keystone, he tries to use press the attack or thunderlords, but he doesn't get as much out of those than other champions.

I'd have to agree, Darksoul1944.  Give me a hard engage warden and an adc that isn't Ezreal, and its a cake walk over the enchanters just now.
I've been seeing a lot of Lux support in my recent games, which I don't know why people are thinking that works again.  In most of my games it ends up with Lux farming under her tower while her adc has been hard engaged and is dead. I guess its ok for the Lux, but thats not really what support is supposed to be doing.
Play a Warden Support. Enchanters like Lulu/Sona/Janna/Nami are out of meta.
The worst bit is, one mistake by your ADC, putting you behind, means you get your support item as late as 10 minutes into the game depending on your support item.
Your complaining about the support role being unwinnable? thats one of the easiest roles right now look at toplane

I mean, i have 80% wr as support.... so it can't be that bad, i'm currently sitting silver 1/gold 5 and have won almost every support game, and lost the rest (35-40 games give or take), i have been a support main since season 4, i don't think supports are getting shafted as such, just that the meta is so unstable atm (stopwatch can suck my ass) that play making is very difficult hence the return to janna/nami meta as disengage, whilst tanks sit lazily watching their team feed
